intro: Verbascum szovitsianum, commonly known as the Szovits mullein, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and large, fuzzy leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in dry, sunny environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
